  • Method Details

    • injectController

      public void injectController​(Controller controller)
      This function is to inject the general controller into B2TabController, allowing access of dataset version and the console.

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      This function is disabling the user editing the datepicker.

    • initializeChart

      public void initializeChart()
      This function is to initialize the chart component.

    • doGenerateChart

      void doGenerateChart​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This function is generating a chart, triggered by clicking the B2GenerateButton. It will check all the input (i.e. startDate, endDate, countries of interest) are filled probably.
      Parameters:
      event -

    • doPickEndDate

      void doPickEndDate​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This function is triggered by picking a date in the B2DatePickerEnd. It will check whether the current combination of startDate and EndDate is valid, then creating a list of countries for the user to choose from.
      Parameters:
      event -

    • doPickStartDate

      void doPickStartDate​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This function is triggered by picking a date in the B2DatePickerStart. It will check whether the current combination of startDate and EndDate is valid, then creating a list of countries for the user to choose from.
      Parameters:
      event -

    • doSwitchToConsole

      void doSwitchToConsole​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This is triggered by clicking the B2ButtonConsoleView. It will switch to the lower scroll pane into Console View.
      Parameters:
      event -

    • doSwitchToChart

      void doSwitchToChart​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This is triggered by clicking the B2ButtonChartView. It will switch to the lower scroll pane into Chart View.
      Parameters:
      event -

    • validateInputDate

      public boolean validateInputDate​(java.time.LocalDate start, java.time.LocalDate end)
      This is a function that check whether the startDate is before endDate.
      Returns:
      boolean indicating whether the input dates are valid.

    • generateSeries

      public javafx.scene.chart.XYChart.Series<java.lang.Number,​java.lang.Number> generateSeries​(java.lang.String location, java.time.LocalDate startDate, java.time.LocalDate endDate)
      This function is used to create a series object for a particular location within the period of interest that will be put into the chart.
      Parameters:
      location - This is the parameter for the country name.
      startDate - This is the parameter for the starting date.
      endDate - This is the parameter for the ending date.
